thread.title: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (10/12): TCU WR Josh Doctson's big night, late TD keeps Horned Frogs perfect
thread.title_full: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (10/12): TCU WR Josh Doctson's big night, late TD keeps Horned Frogs perfect | Dallas Morning News

author: Brandon Wheeland
title: SportsDay's Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week (10/12): TCU WR Josh Doctson's big night, late TD keeps Horned Frogs perfect
text:
Big 12 Offensive Player of the Week
Josh Doctson, TCU WR
Height: 6-foot-3
Weight: 195 pounds
Class: Senior
Season Stats: 50 catches, 877 yards, 10 touchdowns
Why he deserves it: TCU found itself trailing 35-17 at halftime to conference rival Kansas State Saturday night at Snyder Stadium in Manhattan, Kan., but a big second half improved head coach Gary Patterson's Horned Frogs to 6-0 on the season with a 52-45 victory. Doctson caught a 32-yard pass in the first quarter from quarterback Trevone Boykin for the first of his two touchdowns on the evening.
The second scoring reception carried far more weight. With the score knotted up at 45-45, Boykin ran for a nine-yard gain to the TCU 45. On the following play Doctson hauled in a 55-yard TD snag to push the lead to 52-45 with just over a minute on the clock. Kansas State lost a fumble on the following possession to seal the deal for TCU.
In total, the senior receiver caught eight passes on the evening for 155 yards and two touchdowns.
Honorable mention: QB Patrick Mahomes, Texas Tech (33 of 46 passing, 428 yards, 5 TDs in 66-31 win over Iowa State); QB Seth Russell, Baylor (18 of 27 passing, 246 yards, 3 TDs; 5 carries, 6 yards, TD; did not play in second half in 66-7 win over Kansas); QB J.W. Walsh, Oklahoma State (2 of 3 passing, 10 yards, TD; 4 carries, 17 yards, Game-winning overtime TD in 33-26 win over West Virginia)
